resource.name: NZ Central Region Alert
resource.description:
Complex extension recording meta data about all alerts, on who recorded the
[Flag](./StructureDefinition-NZCentralRegionFlag.html) 
and [AllergyIntolerance](./StructureDefinition-NZCentralRegionAllergyIntolerance.html) flavours of Alert and when.

resource.name: HL7 v2 Message
resource.description: Base64 encoded string containing the original HL7 v2 message that was used to create / update the FHIR resource

resource.name: NZ Residency
resource.description: NZ Residency status

resource.name: NZ Central Region - Allergy Alert Category Value Set
resource.description: Alert Category codes ex. WebPAS in NZ Central Region that denote an AllergyIntolerance

resource.name: NZ Central Region - Allergy Reaction Value Set
resource.description: Allergy Reaction codes ex. WebPAS in NZ Central Region.

resource.name: NZ Central Region - NZ ContactRelationship Value Set
resource.description:
NZ ContactRelationship Codes ex. WebPAS in NZ Central Region

This codeset is to be used alongside the HL7 defined general relationship codeset http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/v2-0131

More granular ContactRelationship codes ex. WebPAS in NZ Central Region.

This codeset is to be used alongside the HL7 defined general relationship codeset in http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/valueset-patient-contactrelationship.html

resource.name: Patient-Address-Suburb
resource.description:
An example of a patient from Te Whatu Ora, Central Region, with address containing suburb field,
  and mappings to Domicile and DHB codes.

resource.name: Patient-Contact
resource.description: An example of a patient from Te Whatu Ora, Central Region, with Contact that has multiple codings for the relationship

resource.name: Patient-Ethnicity-MultipleCodings
resource.description: An example of a patient from Te Whatu Ora, Central Region, with multiple ethnicity codings included

resource.name: Patient-HL7Message
resource.description: An example of a patient from Te Whatu Ora, Central Region, including the source HL7 v2 message

resource.name: Patient-LanguageList
resource.description: An example of a patient from Te Whatu Ora, Central Region, with an impossibly large set of languages; lets see that we can validate all of them

resource.name: Patient-LanguageSingle
resource.description: An example of a patient from Te Whatu Ora, Central Region, with a single language of communication

resource.name: Patient-MaritalStatus-CivilUnion
resource.description: An example of a patient from Te Whatu Ora, Central Region, with one of the extra marital status codes

resource.name: Patient-MaritalStatus-Single
resource.description: An example of a patient from Te Whatu Ora, Central Region, with one of the HL7 v3 marital status codes

resource.name: Patient-Practitioner
resource.description: An example of a patient from Te Whatu Ora, Central Region, with General Practitioner element

resource.name: Patient-Religion-NoAnswer
resource.description:
An example of a patient from Te Whatu Ora, Central Region, with religious affiliation 'Objects to question'
  Which means there is no equivalent coding from http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/v3-ReligiousAffiliation

resource.name: Patient-Religion-Presbyterian
resource.description:
An example of a patient from Te Whatu Ora, Central Region, with religious affiliation requiring two codings:
 * The raw coding from WebPAS with coding from https://standards.digital.health.nz/ns/central-region/patient-religion
 * Equivalent coding from http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/v3-ReligiousAffiliation

resource.name: Patient-Residency
resource.description: An example of a patient from Te Whatu Ora, Central Region, with multiple NZ Residency codings
